alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Central and Southern Scott County; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Marion; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 29 at 9:43PM CDT until June 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Maximum heat index values from 105 to 110 degrees. * WHERE...Parts of north central Arkansas including the Ozark Mountains. * WHEN...From noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
